content: (Bloomberg) -- Ever since OPEC started ramping up supplies in April, the group has drawn reassurance from one key oil indicator: the price curve. content: In a rare and poignant act, Linda Murphy, a Massachusetts woman, wrote her own obituary—full of humour and grace—before passing away on September 21. Her farewell note, which she wrote five months before her death, has now gone viral. Murphy was diagnosed with Bulbar ALS, a neurodegenerative disease, in 2022. Bulbar ALS, also known as bulbar-onset amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, is a subtype of ALS, a progressive neurological disorder that affects nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord.

content: New Delhi, Oct 3 (PTI) Cosmetic major L'Oréal India's profit in FY25 increased 22.6 per cent to ₹597.54 crore, while its net sales were up 6.25 per cent to ₹5,925.33 crore, the company said in an RoC filing. content: On Friday, the benchmark Sensex climbed 223 points to close at 81,207. Amid the broader market rally, eight stocks from the BSE 200 index soared to their 52‑week highs — the highest levels in the past year. Such breakouts are generally seen by traders and investors as bullish indicators, suggesting strong upward momentum and the potential for continued gains. In the past month, the stock has gained about 20%.

title: FBI chief Kash Patel fires trainee for displaying gay pride flag in office

The trainee, a former FBI support specialist in Los An

content: The New York Stock Exchange. US stocks advanced on Friday, sending benchmarks to fresh records as risk-on momentum spurred by bets on artificial intelligence and expectations for further interest-rate cuts catapulted the market higher. The S&P 500 rose 0.5% and the Nasdaq 100 Index climbed 0.2% at 12:40 p.m. in New York. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 1.1%, while the Russell 2000 Index rose 1.5%. All the gauges touched new all-time highs. The Cboe VIX Index hovered near 16.3.

content: Copper recorded its biggest weekly advance in year, with prices edging closer to a record set last year, as supply disruptions, a weaker US dollar and optimism about demand support gains. Three-month futures on the London Metal Exchange rose 5.2% for the week, the biggest weekly advance since late September last year. Copper climbed 2.1% on Friday alone, settling at $10,715 a ton — less than $400 shy of an all-time high.

content: By Jaspreet Kalra MUMBAI, Sept 26 (Reuters) - The Indian rupee managed to hold above its all-time low on Friday, supported by likely central bank intervention, even as steep U.S. tariffs on branded drug imports compounded lingering concerns over a hit to trade and foreign portfolio flows. content: Listen to Justin read this article One morning last year, John Gladwin opened the cupboard under his kitchen sink and discovered a bag of soil he'd been storing there was torn to shreds. Days later he noticed a pungent smell too. It was musty and slightly astringent, not unlike the communal bin area in his block of flats. "I knew what it was straight away," he says. "Rats." He'd often seen them scurrying around near bins. Now they were inside his home too.
